SocioDemographic

# Gender
table(dataactor$Gender)

# Create a standardized education category
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)

dataactor$Edu <- factor(
  case_when(
    dataactor$`Level of Education` %in% c("Primary School", "Junior HS", "Senior HS") ~ "Basic Education",
    dataactor$`Level of Education` %in% c("Vocational School", "3y Diploma") ~ "Vocational",
    dataactor$`Level of Education` %in% c("Bachelor", "Bachelor Adm Negara", "Master Degre") ~ "College Degree",
    TRUE ~ "Other"
  ),
  levels = c("Basic Education", "Vocational", "College Degree"),
  ordered = TRUE
)
table(dataactor$Edu)

title: FOOD SAFETY QUESTIONNAIRE
text:
This research questionnaire is compiled based on the criteria of the ISO Food Safety Management System, HACCP, and GMP, with a focus on a simple evaluation of the implementation or application of food safety requirements at the level of MSME and street food business actors in the APEC Region.
The criteria in the ISO Food Safety Management System, HACCP, and GMP included in this questionnaire are only relevant and have the potential to guarantee food safety based on the literature study that has been conducted. This questionnaire aims to capture the experiences, obstacles, and challenges of MSME and street food business actors in order to increase knowledge and understanding of food safety based on international standards.
This questionnaire takes about 20-25 minutes to fill out. Your identity will not be published, and all data resulting from this questionnaire will be used entirely for research purposes. You can also participate using the e-form via the following link: https://bit.ly/foodbusinessactors. The data collected will only be accessible to members of the research team and will be presented in aggregate form. There is absolutely no obligation for you to participate in this research; you are free to withdraw at any time.
If you have any questions about the research or your participation, you can contact the Project Overseer (PO) of the project, Mr. Dulbert Tampubolon (email: tdulbert@gmail.com) from the Research Center for Testing Technology and Standard, BRIN. The information obtained through this questionnaire is guaranteed to be confidential and is for research purposes only. Therefore, we ask for your willingness to fill out this questionnaire.

title: REGULATOR ASSESSMENT
text:
Legality

# Count responses
response_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`1. Are there any regulations regarding the supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses in local?`))
colnames(response_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
response_counts$Percentage <- round(response_counts$Count / sum(response_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(response_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
  geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
  coord_polar(theta = "y") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
            position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
            size = 5) +
scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    axis.text = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_blank(),
    legend.position = "right",
    legend.title = element_blank(),

title: FOOD SAFETY QUESTIONNAIRE
text:
This research questionnaire is compiled based on the criteria of the ISO Food Safety Management System, HACCP, and GMP, with a focus on a simple evaluation of the implementation or application of food safety requirements at the level of MSME and street food business actors in the APEC Region.
The criteria in the ISO Food Safety Management System, HACCP, and GMP included in this questionnaire are only relevant and have the potential to guarantee food safety based on the literature study that has been conducted. This questionnaire is intended for inspectors and supervisors who are authorized to supervise and foster local food businesses. The questionnaire also aims to collect information in supervising MSME and street food business actors to improve knowledge and understanding of food safety based on international standards.
It takes about 10-15 minutes to complete this questionnaire. Your identity will not be published, and all data resulting from this questionnaire will be used entirely for research purposes. You can also participate using the e-form via the following link: https://bit.ly/foodbusinessregulators. The data collected will only be accessible to members of the research team and will be presented in aggregate form. There is absolutely no obligation for you to participate in this research; you are free to withdraw at any time.
If you have any questions about the research or your participation, you can contact the Project Overseer (PO) of the project, Mr. Dulbert Tampubolon (email: tdulbert@gmail.com) from the Research Center for Testing Technology and Standard, BRIN. The information obtained through this questionnaire is guaranteed to be confidential and is for research purposes only. Therefore, we ask for your willingness to fill out this questionnaire.

title: Actor
text:
# Load required libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(treemapify)
library(corrplot)
library(knitr)
library(leaflet)
library(wordcloud)
library(RColorBrewer)

# For this analysis, we assume the data is already collected from the questionnaire
# and stored in a CSV file. Let's simulate this data.

set.seed(123) # For reproducibility

# Create a function to simulate responses (Yes/No)
simulate_binary <- function(n, yes_prob = 0.7) {
  sample(c("Yes", "No"), n, replace = TRUE, prob = c(yes_prob, 1-yes_prob))
}

# Create a function to simulate categorical responses
simulate_categorical <- function(n, categories, probs = NULL) {
  sample(categories, n, replace = TRUE, prob = probs)
}

# Simulate data for 200 respondents
n_respondents <- 200

# Basic demographics
gender <- simulate_categorical(n_respondents, c("Male", "Female"), c(0.6, 0.4))
education <- simulate_categorical(n_respondents, 
                                 c("Elementary", "Middle School", "High School", "Bachelor", "Master", "PhD"),
                                 c(0.1, 0.15, 0.4, 0.25, 0.08, 0.02))
locations <- simulate_categorical(n_respondents,
                                 c("Jakarta", "Surabaya", "Bandung", "Medan", "Makassar", "Yogyakarta", "Other"),
                                 c(0.25, 0.15, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.2))
shop_types <- simulate_categorical(n_respondents,
                                  c("Street Food Cart", "Small Restaurant", "Food Stall", "Market Vendor", "Home Business"),
                                  c(0.3, 0.2, 0.25, 0.15, 0.1))
experience_years <- sample(0:30, n_respondents, replace = TRUE, prob = dnorm(0:30, 8, 5))

# Key Food Safety Categories
ownership <- data.frame(
  owner = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.8),
  own_capital = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.7),
  has_license = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4),
  has_permit = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.3)
)

leadership <- data.frame(
  has_manager = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.5),
  safety_responsible = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4),
  supplier_responsible = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.3),
  has_guidelines = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.25),
  has_provisions = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.3)
)

human_resources <- data.frame(
  relevant_skills = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.6),
  protective_gear = simulate_categorical(n_respondents, 
                                       c("None", "Basic", "Standard", "Complete"),
                                       c(0.3, 0.4, 0.2, 0.1)),
  no_smoking = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.5),
  hand_washing = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.6),
  special_attire = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4),
  good_health = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.7),
  health_checks = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.2)
)

infrastructure <- data.frame(
  handwash_facility = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4),
  handwash_soap = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.3),
  clean_floors = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.5),
  clean_tabletop = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.6),
  no_pests = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4),
  proper_storage = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.5),
  clean_equipment = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.6),
  waste_management = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4),
  has_refrigerator = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.5)
)

product_quality <- data.frame(
  food_type = simulate_categorical(n_respondents, 
                                 c("Ready to eat", "Fast food", "Fresh food", "Multiple types"),
                                 c(0.3, 0.3, 0.2, 0.2)),
  separate_raw_cooked = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.6),
  wash_ingredients = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.7),
  water_source = simulate_categorical(n_respondents,
                                    c("Water company", "Well water", "River water", "Refill water", "Other"),
                                    c(0.4, 0.3, 0.1, 0.15, 0.05)),
  handle_expired = simulate_categorical(n_respondents,
                                      c("Discard", "Reprocess", "Continue using", "Other"),
                                      c(0.5, 0.2, 0.2, 0.1))
)

employee_competence <- data.frame(
  food_safety_knowledge = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.3),
  safety_training = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.2),
  basic_principles = simulate_binary(n_respondents, 0.4)
)

# Combine all data
food_safety_data <- data.frame(
  id = 1:n_respondents,
  gender = gender,
  education = education,
  location = locations,
  shop_type = shop_types,
  experience_years = experience_years,
  ownership,
  leadership,
  human_resources,
  infrastructure,
  product_quality,
  employee_competence
)

# Calculate compliance scores by category
food_safety_data <- food_safety_data %>%
  mutate(
    ownership_score = rowMeans(ownership == "Yes", na.rm = TRUE),
    leadership_score = rowMeans(leadership == "Yes", na.rm = TRUE),
    hr_score = rowMeans(human_resources[, c("relevant_skills", "no_smoking", "hand_washing", 
                                          "special_attire", "good_health", "health_checks")] == "Yes", na.rm = TRUE),
    infrastructure_score = rowMeans(infrastructure == "Yes", na.rm = TRUE),
    product_score = rowMeans(product_quality[, c("separate_raw_cooked", "wash_ingredients")] == "Yes", na.rm = TRUE),
    competence_score = rowMeans(employee_competence == "Yes", na.rm = TRUE),
    overall_score = (ownership_score + leadership_score + hr_score + 
                    infrastructure_score + product_score + competence_score) / 6
  )

# Overall compliance distribution
ggplot(food_safety_data, aes(x = overall_score)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, fill = "steelblue", color = "white") +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = mean(overall_score)), color = "red", linetype = "dashed") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Overall Food Safety Compliance",
       subtitle = paste("Average score:", round(mean(food_safety_data$overall_score), 2)),
       x = "Compliance Score (0-1)",
       y = "Number of Businesses") +
  theme_minimal()

# Compliance scores by category
category_scores <- food_safety_data %>%
  summarize(
    Ownership = mean(ownership_score),
    Leadership = mean(leadership_score),
    "Human Resources" = mean(hr_score),
    Infrastructure = mean(infrastructure_score),
    "Product Quality" = mean(product_score),
    "Employee Competence" = mean(competence_score)
  ) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = everything(), names_to = "Category", values_to = "Score")

ggplot(category_scores, aes(x = reorder(Category, Score), y = Score, fill = Score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "red", high = "green") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Food Safety Compliance by Category",
       subtitle = "Average scores across all businesses",
       y = "Compliance Score (0-1)",
       x = "") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")

# Food safety compliance by education level
education_compliance <- food_safety_data %>%
  group_by(education) %>%
  summarize(avg_score = mean(overall_score)) %>%
  arrange(desc(avg_score))

ggplot(education_compliance, aes(x = reorder(education, avg_score), y = avg_score, fill = avg_score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "orange", high = "darkgreen") +
  labs(title = "Food Safety Compliance by Education Level",
       x = "Education Level",
       y = "Average Compliance Score") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  coord_flip()

# Food safety compliance by experience years
ggplot(food_safety_data, aes(x = experience_years, y = overall_score)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5, color = "blue") +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", color = "red") +
  labs(title = "Food Safety Compliance vs. Years of Experience",
       x = "Years of Experience",
       y = "Compliance Score") +
  theme_minimal()

# Correlation matrix between different compliance areas
cor_matrix <- food_safety_data %>%
  select(ends_with("_score")) %>%
  cor()

corrplot(cor_matrix, method = "circle", type = "upper", 
         tl.col = "black", tl.srt = 45, 
         title = "Correlation Between Food Safety Dimensions",
         mar = c(0, 0, 1, 0))

# Specific critical issues analysis
critical_issues <- data.frame(
  Issue = c("No business license", "No food safety responsible person", 
            "No hand washing facilities", "No refrigeration", 
            "No food safety training", "No separate raw/cooked food"),
  Percentage = c(
    mean(food_safety_data$has_license == "No"),
    mean(food_safety_data$safety_responsible == "No"),
    mean(food_safety_data$handwash_facility == "No"),
    mean(food_safety_data$has_refrigerator == "No"),
    mean(food_safety_data$safety_training == "No"),
    mean(food_safety_data$separate_raw_cooked == "No")
  ) * 100
)

critical_issues <- critical_issues %>%
  arrange(desc(Percentage))

ggplot(critical_issues, aes(x = reorder(Issue, Percentage), y = Percentage, fill = Percentage)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "green", high = "red") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Critical Food Safety Issues",
       subtitle = "Percentage of businesses with compliance issues",
       x = "",
       y = "Percentage of Businesses (%)") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")

# Compliance gaps by shop type
shop_compliance <- food_safety_data %>%
  group_by(shop_type) %>%
  summarize(
    Ownership = mean(ownership_score),
    Leadership = mean(leadership_score),
    HR = mean(hr_score),
    Infrastructure = mean(infrastructure_score),
    Product = mean(product_score),
    Competence = mean(competence_score)
  ) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = -shop_type, names_to = "Category", values_to = "Score")

ggplot(shop_compliance, aes(x = Category, y = Score, fill = shop_type)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Food Safety Compliance by Shop Type and Category",
       x = "Category",
       y = "Average Compliance Score",
       fill = "Shop Type") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

# Geographical comparison (if data available)
location_compliance <- food_safety_data %>%
  group_by(location) %>%
  summarize(avg_score = mean(overall_score)) %>%
  arrange(desc(avg_score))

ggplot(location_compliance, aes(x = reorder(location, avg_score), y = avg_score, fill = avg_score)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "red", high = "green") +
  labs(title = "Food Safety Compliance by Location",
       x = "Location",
       y = "Average Compliance Score") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  coord_flip()

# Key insights and recommendations

# Key Insights for Stakeholders

## Overall Compliance Status
- The average food safety compliance score across all businesses is moderate at [score].
- There's significant variation in compliance, with many businesses falling below acceptable levels.

## Critical Areas Needing Intervention
1. Employee Competence shows the lowest compliance - only [x]% of businesses have staff with food safety training.
2. Documentation and record-keeping are severely lacking across all business types.
3. Infrastructure gaps, particularly hand-washing facilities and proper refrigeration, present immediate risks.

## Targeted Recommendations
1. **Regulatory Bodies**: Implement simplified licensing processes with basic food safety requirements.
2. **Training Institutions**: Develop practical, short-format food safety training tailored for MSMEs.
3. **Business Owners**: Focus on low-cost, high-impact interventions like hand-washing stations and raw/cooked food separation.
4. **Investors/Donors**: Direct resources to subsidize critical infrastructure like refrigeration units and clean water facilities.

## Regional Priorities
- Regions with lowest compliance: [Regions]
- Focus areas should be tailored by location, with [specific region] needing immediate attention on [specific issue].

These insights enable targeted interventions that balance food safety requirements with the practical realities of MSME operations in the APEC region.
